place.name: STAINTON BY LANGWORTH
place.gazetteerText: STAINTON-BY-LANGWORTH, a parish, with three hamlets, in the district and county of Lincoln; 1¼ mile NNE of Langworth r. station, and 4 W of Wragby. Post town, Lincoln. Acres, 3,021. Real property, £3,320. Pop., 213. Houses, 40. The manor belongs to the Earl of Scarborough. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £183. Patron, the Earl of Scarborough. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
